what: Metadata of the output columns of the TreeData package
title: TreeData
text: Comment (character): error type informations Bota - Family_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Family name - FamilyCorSource (character): source Family correction - Genus_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Genus name - Species_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Species name - BotanicalCorrectionSource (character): source Genus Species correction - ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character): corrected ScientificName - VernName_TreeDataCor (character): completed information available IdTree level. Life Status - LifeStatus_TreeDataCor (logical): corrected stem life status. Taper - TaperDBH_TreeDataCor (numeric): corrected trees diameter default HOM Diameter - Diameter_TreeDataCor (numeric): corrected trees diameter default HOM - DiameterCorrectionMeth (character): diameter correction methode = “taper”/“local linear regression”/“weighted mean” /phylogenetic hierarchical(“species”/“genus”/“family”/“stand”)/“shift realignment”/“value”. - POM_TreeDataCor (factor): POM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st POM value stem measured - HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds DefaultHOM Taper correction applied. , corresponds 1st HOM value stem measured Recruitment - CorrectedRecruit (logical): TRUE: row added represent year stem larger minimum diameter, absent dataset. FALSE: original dataset row.

text: Botanical Correction

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
code: BotanicalCorrection(Data, Source = NULL, WFOData = NULL, DetectOnly = FALSE)

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdTree (character) Family (character) Genus (character) Species (character) VernName (character) ScientificName (character) Source (character) correct standardise, can choose : "TPL": Plant List (http://www.theplantlist.org/) (faster based 2013 taxonomy) "WFO": World Flora Online (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/) (long time based 2022 taxonomy) NULL: error detection (DetectOnly = TRUE) WFOData filled argument Source = "WFO". Data set static copy World Flora Online (WFO) Taxonomic Backbone data (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/downloadData.) (data.frame data.table) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (Default: FALSE) (logical)

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
text: Fill Comment column error type informations. DetectOnly = FALSE, add columns: Family_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Family name FamilyCorSource (character): source Family correction Genus_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Genus name Species_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Species name BotanicalCorrectionSource (character): source Genus Species correction ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character): corrected Scientific name VernName_TreeDataCor (character): completed information available IdTree level.

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
text: special characters (typography) family name Genus Species columns (suffix "aceae" specific family name. Correct spelling botanical names (Taxonstand WorldFlora) Family & Scientific names match (BIOMASS::getTaxonomy WorldFlora) Update scientific botanical names current phylogenetic classification Check invariant botanical informations per IdTree (1 IdTree = 1 family, 1 scientific 1 vernacular name)

title: Botanical Correction — BotanicalCorrection
code: if (FALSE) { library(data.table) data(TestData)  # With The Plant List: Rslt <- BotanicalCorrection(TestData, Source = "TPL")  ScfcCor <- unique(Rslt[ScientificNameCor != ScientificName,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor, FamilyCorSource,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  FamCor <- unique(Rslt[FamilyCor != Family,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor, FamilyCorSource,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  # With World Flora Online: WFO_Backbone <- file.choose() load(WFO_Backbone)  RsltWFO <- BotanicalCorrection(TestData, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone)  ScfcCor <- unique(RsltWFO[ScientificNameCor != ScientificName,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ])  FamCor <- unique(RsltWFO[FamilyCor != Family,                 list(ScientificName, ScientificNameCor,                 Family, FamilyCor,                 Genus, GenusCor,                 Species, SpeciesCor, Subspecies,                 BotanicalCorrectionSource, Comment)                 ]) }

title: Compute Colleagues Growth Mean — ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean
text: Internal function PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection()

title: Compute Colleagues Growth Mean — ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean
code: ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean(   Colleagues,   Data,   PrevValue,   PositiveGrowthThreshold,   NegativeGrowthThreshold,   DBHRange )

title: Compute Colleagues Growth Mean — ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean
text: Colleagues 'Colleagues' individuals one whose diameter corrected. diameter included 'DBHRange' around diameter corrected. either species, genus, family stand, depending inventory proposes minimum selection criteria user ('MinIndividualNbr' argument PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection()). (data.table) dataset must contain column: 'IdStem' 'IdTree' (character) Data (data.table) dataset must contain columns: 'IdStem' 'IdTree' (character) 'Diameter' (numeric) 'Year' (numeric) PrevValue last diameter value one correct (cm) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year : tree widening x cm/year considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census : possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value)

title: Compute Colleagues Growth Mean — ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean
text: average growth 'colleagues' DBH range (numeric)

title: Compute Colleagues Growth Mean — ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean
code: data(TestData)  PrevValue <- 17 # Estimated DBH (cm) DBHRange = 10 # DBH range (cm)  # Find colleagues Colleagues <- TestData[ ScientificName == "Licania membranacea" & # same species as the tree to be corrected (Diameter > (PrevValue - DBHRange/2) & Diameter < (PrevValue + DBHRange/2))] # Diameter or DBHCor ?  ColleaguesCrescMean <- ComputeColleaguesGrowthMean(Colleagues = Colleagues, Data = TestData,                                                    PrevValue = PrevValue,                                                    PositiveGrowthThreshold = 5,                                                    NegativeGrowthThreshold = -2,                                                    DBHRange = DBHRange)

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Diameter correction

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
code: DiameterCorrection(   Data,   KeepMeas = c("MaxHOM", "MaxDate"),   DefaultHOM = 1.3,   MaxDBH = 500,   PositiveGrowthThreshold = 5,   NegativeGrowthThreshold = -2,   Pioneers = NULL,   PioneersGrowthThreshold = 7.5,   WhatToCorrect = c("POM change", "punctual", "shift"),   CorrectionType = c("individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical"),   DBHRange = 10,   MinIndividualNbr = 5,   OtherCrit = NULL,   Digits = 1L,   DBHCorForDeadTrees = TRUE,   coef = 0.9,   DetectOnly = FALSE )

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdTree IdStem (character) ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) POM (Point Measurement) (factor) HOM (Height Measurement) (numeric) want correct "POM change" want apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction, dataset must also contain columns: Genus_TreeDataCor (character) Family_TreeDataCor (character) KeepMeas case multiple diameter measurements census year: Possible values: "MaxHOM", "MaxDate" (character). "MaxHOM": apply correction measurement taken highest POM "MaxDate": apply correction recent measurement (year recent date) DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) MaxDBH Maximum possible DBH (Diameter default HOM) stand cm (numeric, 1 value) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree widening value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census: possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) Pioneers Scientific names pioneer species site, ScientificName_TreeDataCor column (characters vector) PioneersGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree pioneer species widens value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) WhatToCorrect Possible values: "POM change", "punctual", "shift" (character) "POM change": detect POM change column POM correct Diameter values . "punctual": detect error punctual correct interpolation. "shift": detect shift several Diameter values links 1st measurements set. CorrectionType Possible values: "individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical" (character). "individual": replace abnormal growth interpolation individual values. "phylogenetic hierarchical": replace abnormal growth average growth trees dataset, specific, genus, family stand level, within DBH range x cm (DBHRange argument). number trees < n (MinIndividualNbr argument) specific level, switch genus level etc. DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) Digits Number decimal places used DBHCor column (Default: 1L) (integer) DBHCorForDeadTrees (logical) TRUE: return DBHCor also dead trees. FALSE: return DBHCor dead trees. case advisable corrected tree life status StatusCorrection() function. coef description... (numeric) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (Default: FALSE) (logical)

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: Fill Comment column error type informations. DetectOnly = FALSE, add columns: Diameter_TreeDataCor: corrected trees diameter default HOM DiameterCorrectionMeth = "local linear regression","weighted mean"/phylogenetic hierarchical("species"/"genus"/"family"/"stand")/ "shift realignment"/"value". POM_TreeDataCor (factor): POM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st POM value stem measured. HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM value corrected diameters proposed. Corresponds 1st HOM value stem measured.

title: Diameter correction — DiameterCorrection
text: 1 Diameter value tree/stem, Diameter_TreeDataCor takes original Diameter value. value 0 > MaxDBH, Diameter_TreeDataCor takes NA. Diameters linked IdTree/IdStem Census Year processed. Punctual error correction linear regression quadratic, punctual errors corrected local regression 2 framing values.

title: DiameterCorrectionByTree — DiameterCorrectionByTree
code: library(data.table) data(TestData)   DataTree <- data.table(IdStem = "c",       ScientificName = "A",       Year = c(seq(2000,2008, by = 2), 2012, 2014,2016, 2020), # 9 Diameter values       Diameter = c(13:16, 16-4, (16-4)+2, (16-4)+3, 15-4, (15-4)+2), # 0.5 cm/year       POM = as.factor(c(0, 0, 0, 0, 1, 1, 1, 2, 2)))  Rslt <- DiameterCorrectionByTree(   DataTree, TestData,   WhatToCorrect = c("POM change", "punctual", "shift"),   CorrectionType = c("linear", "individual")   ) setnames(Rslt, "POMCor", "POM_TreeDataCor") DiameterCorrectionPlot(Rslt, CorCol = "DBHCor")

title: Full error processing — FullErrorProcessing
code: FullErrorProcessing(   Data,   DetectOnly = FALSE,   Source = NULL,   WFOData = NULL,   InvariantColumns = c("Site", "Genus_TreeDataCor", "Species_TreeDataCor",     "Family_TreeDataCor", "ScientificName_TreeDataCor"),   DeathConfirmation = 2,   UseSize = FALSE,   RemoveRBeforeAlive = FALSE,   RemoveRAfterDeath = FALSE,   DefaultHOM = 1.3,   TaperParameter = function(DAB, HOM) 0.156 - 0.023 * log(DAB) - 0.021 * log(HOM),   TaperFormula = function(DAB, HOM, TaperParameter, DefaultHOM)     DAB/(exp(-TaperParameter * (HOM - DefaultHOM))),   KeepMeas = c("MaxHOM", "MaxDate"),   MaxDBH = 500,   PositiveGrowthThreshold = 5,   NegativeGrowthThreshold = -2,   Pioneers = NULL,   PioneersGrowthThreshold = 7.5,   WhatToCorrect = c("taper", "POM change", "punctual", "shift"),   CorrectionType = c("individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical"),   DBHRange = 10,   MinIndividualNbr = 5,   OtherCrit = NULL,   Digits = 1L,   DBHCorForDeadTrees = TRUE,   coef = 0.9,   MinDBH = 10 )

title: Full error processing — FullErrorProcessing
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (Default: FALSE) (logical) Source (character) correct standardise, can choose : "TPL": Plant List (http://www.theplantlist.org/) (faster based 2013 taxonomy) "WFO": World Flora Online (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/) (long time based 2022 taxonomy) NULL: error detection (DetectOnly = TRUE) WFOData filled argument Source = "WFO". Data set static copy World Flora Online (WFO) Taxonomic Backbone data (http://www.worldfloraonline.org/downloadData.) (data.frame data.table) InvariantColumns Vector names columns supposed always value measurement tree (character). recommended use columns already corrected, columns containing corrected botanical information. DeathConfirmation Number times (censuses) needed unseen tree considered dead (numeric)  (Default = 2 censuses) UseSize Use size presence witness living status tree (logical) (Default = FALSE) RemoveRBeforeAlive want delete rows tree seen alive 1st time? (logical) RemoveRAfterDeath correction want delete rows concerning tree death? (logical) DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) TaperParameter Taper parameter (unitless) formula (function) Default: TaperParameter = 0.156 - 0.023 log(DAB) - 0.021 log(HOM) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) TaperFormula Taper formula (function) Default: DAB / (e^(- TaperParameter (HOM - DefaultHOM))) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) DefaultHOM:  Default Height Measurement (m) TaperParameter: Taper parameter (unitless) KeepMeas case multiple diameter measurements census year: Possible values: "MaxHOM", "MaxDate" (character). "MaxHOM": apply correction measurement taken highest POM "MaxDate": apply correction recent measurement (year recent date) MaxDBH Maximum possible DBH (Diameter default HOM) stand cm (numeric, 1 value) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree widening value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census: possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) Pioneers Scientific names pioneer species site, ScientificName_TreeDataCor column (characters vector) PioneersGrowthThreshold cm/year: tree pioneer species widens value considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) WhatToCorrect Possible values: "POM change", "punctual", "shift" (character) "POM change": detect POM change column POM correct Diameter values . "punctual": detect error punctual correct interpolation. "shift": detect shift several Diameter values links 1st measurements set. CorrectionType Possible values: "individual", "phylogenetic hierarchical" (character). "individual": replace abnormal growth interpolation individual values. "phylogenetic hierarchical": replace abnormal growth average growth trees dataset, specific, genus, family stand level, within DBH range x cm (DBHRange argument). number trees < n (MinIndividualNbr argument) specific level, switch genus level etc. DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) Digits Number decimal places used DBHCor column (Default: 1L) (integer) DBHCorForDeadTrees (logical) TRUE: return DBHCor also dead trees. FALSE: return DBHCor dead trees. case advisable corrected tree life status StatusCorrection() function. coef description... (numeric) MinDBH Minimum diameter trees inventoried according protocol (cm) (numeric, 1 value) (Default = 10 cm)

title: Full error processing — FullErrorProcessing
code: data(TestData) Rslt <- FullErrorProcessing(TestData, DetectOnly = TRUE) #> Warning: Non-unique association of IdTree(s) with Plot, Subplot and TreeFieldNum: #>    IdTree Plot Subplot TreeFieldNum #> 1: 101658    6    none         2352 #> 2: 101658    6    none          845 #> 3: 397145    6    none          379 #> 4: 397145    6    none         2991 #>   if (FALSE) { WFO_Backbone <- file.choose() load(WFO_Backbone) Rslt_Test <- FullErrorProcessing(TestData, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone) Rslt_Panama <- FullErrorProcessing(PanamaFormated, Source = "WFO", WFOData = WFO_Backbone) }

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection
text: Correct 'shift' diameter errors, based individual's non-abnormal growths. Greater weight given growths recorded diameter close one correct. weighted mean non-abnormal growths computed applied correct abnormal diameter.

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection
text: DataTree dataset corresponding single tree/stem's (1 IdTree/IdStem) measurements (data.frame data.table) filled want column "DiameterCorrectionMeth" (correction method) filled corresponding row. Otherwise leave DataTree = NULL DBHCor Diameter vector (numeric) Time Time vector (numeric) cresc Annual diameter increment NA instead abnormal values (numeric) cresc_abs Absolute diameter increment (divided time 2 values) NA instead abnormal values (numeric) cresc_abn Abnormal diameter increment positions (numeric) coef description... (numeric)

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection
text: List 2 objects: DBHCor (numeric vector): corrected method DataTree (data.table): DiameterCorrectionMeth column filled correction method ("weighted mean", "shift realignment")

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection
text: Method: Correct 1st value shift ("weighted mean"): Compute absolute difference DBH correct others Give respective weights growth (cresc) values according distance DBH correct Compute weighted mean growths (cresc) Apply weighted mean correct abnormal DBH Correct following values shift ("shift realignment"): value = previous value + initial growth

title: Individual Diameter Shift Correction — IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection
code: DBHCor = c(13:16, 16-4, (16-4)+2, (16-4)+3, 15-4, (15-4)+2) Time = c(seq(2000,2008, by = 2), 2012, 2014,2016, 2020) plot(Time, DBHCor)  cresc <- ComputeIncrementation(Var = DBHCor, Type = "annual", Time = Time) cresc_abs <- ComputeIncrementation(Var = DBHCor, Type = "absolute", Time = Time) cresc_abn <- which(cresc >= 5 | cresc_abs < -2) # abnormal values indices cresc[cresc_abn] <- NA cresc_abs[cresc_abn] <- NA  Rslt <- IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection(DBHCor = DBHCor, Time = Time,                                   cresc = cresc, cresc_abs = cresc_abs,                                   cresc_abn = cresc_abn)  library(ggplot2) ggplot() +   aes(x = Time) +   geom_point(aes(y = Rslt$DBHCor),              col = "forestgreen") +   geom_line(aes(y = Rslt$DBHCor),             col = "forestgreen") +   geom_point(aes(y = DBHCor),              col = "red") +   geom_line(aes(y = DBHCor),             col = "red") +   theme_minimal() +   labs(x = "Year", y = "Diameter (cm)")

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
text: Corrects series abnormal diameters tree using mean growth trees (minimum number trees) species/genus/family/stand diameter class.

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
code: PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection(   DataTree,   Data,   cresc,   cresc_abs,   cresc_abn,   DBHCor,   Time,   PositiveGrowthThreshold,   NegativeGrowthThreshold,   DBHRange = 10,   MinIndividualNbr = 5,   OtherCrit = NULL,   coef )

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
text: DataTree dataset corresponding single tree/stem's (1 IdTree/IdStem) measurements (data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdStem IdTree(character) ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character) Genus_TreeDataCor (character) Family_TreeDataCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) Data Complete dataset (data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdStem (character) ScientificName_TreeDataCor (character) Genus_TreeDataCor (character) Family_TreeDataCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) cresc Annual diameter increment (numeric) cresc_abs Absolute diameter increment (divided time 2 values) (numeric) cresc_abn Abnormal diameter increment positions (numeric) DBHCor Diameter vector cm (numeric) Time Time vector years (numeric) PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year : tree widening x cm/year considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census : possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) coef (numeric) Necessary argument case number individuals insufficient apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction, case "individual" correction applied (see IndividualDiameterShiftCorrection() function)

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
text: Fill columns: DBHCor: corrected trees diameter default HOM DiameterCorrectionMeth = "species"/"genus"/"family"/"stand"/"shift realignment"

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
text: assumed abnormal diameters measured different height default. therefore correct 1st value mean growth trees. following values corrected corrected value 1st value, keeping originally measured growth. Correct 1st value series: Find individual diameter class (DBHRange) last value one correct, species, genus, family stand tree correct, minimum number individuals required consider correction reached (MinIndividualNbr). Take non-abnormal growths measured different HOM previous value. 1st abnormal DBH series = previous value + mean growth trees Correct following values series: abnormal DBH series = previous value + original growth.

title: Phylogenetic Hierarchical Correction — PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection
code: data(TestData) DataTree <- TestData[IdTree %in% "100658"]  # Inputs DataTree$Year <-  c(2000, 2002, 2004, 2006, 2008, 2010) DataTree$Diameter <- c(13, 14, 15, 12, 13, 14) cresc <- c(0.5, 0.5, NA, 0.5, 0.5) cresc_abs <- c(1, 1, NA, 1, 1) cresc_abn <- 3   DataTree_output <- PhylogeneticHierarchicalCorrection(     DataTree = DataTree,     Data = TestData,     cresc = cresc, cresc_abs = cresc_abs, cresc_abn = cresc_abn,     DBHCor = DataTree$Diameter, Time = DataTree$Year,     PositiveGrowthThreshold = 5,     NegativeGrowthThreshold = -2,     DBHRange = 10, MinIndividualNbr = 5,     OtherCrit = "Plot" )

title: StatusCorrectionByTree — StatusCorrectionByTree
text: DataTree dataset corresponding single tree's (1 IdTree/IdStem) measurements (data.frame data.table) LifeStatus column must coded : - TRUE = alive, - FALSE = dead, - NA = unseen PlotCensuses Census years plot tree (numeric integer) InvariantColumns Vector names columns supposed always value measurement tree (character). recommended use columns already corrected, columns containing corrected botanical information. DeathConfirmation Number times (censuses) needed unseen tree considered dead (numeric) UseSize Use size presence witness living status tree (logical) AddRowsForForgottenCensuses TRUE: adds rows forgotten censuses 2 'Alive', FALSE: add rows (logical) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (logical) RemoveRBeforeAlive want delete rows tree seen alive 1st time? (logical) RemoveRAfterDeath correction want delete rows concerning tree death? (logical)

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: TaperCorrection

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
code: TaperCorrection(   Data,   DefaultHOM = 1.3,   TaperParameter = function(DAB, HOM) 0.156 - 0.023 * log(DAB) - 0.021 * log(HOM),   TaperFormula = function(DAB, HOM, TaperParameter, DefaultHOM)     DAB/(exp(-TaperParameter * (HOM - DefaultHOM))),   DetectOnly = FALSE )

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: Data Dataset (data.frame data.table) dataset must contain columns: Diameter (numeric) HOM (Height Measurement) (numeric) DefaultHOM Default Height Measurement meter (Default: 1.3 m) (numeric, 1 value) TaperParameter Taper parameter (unitless) formula (function) Default: TaperParameter = 0.156 - 0.023 log(DAB) - 0.021 log(HOM) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) TaperFormula Taper formula (function) Default: DAB / (e^(- TaperParameter (HOM - DefaultHOM))) Cushman et al.2021. : DAB: Diameter Buttress (cm) HOM: Height Measurement (m) DefaultHOM:  Default Height Measurement (m) TaperParameter: Taper parameter (unitless) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (Default: FALSE) (logical)

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
text: Fill Comment column error type informations. DetectOnly = FALSE, add columns: - TaperDBH_TreeDataCor: corrected trees diameter default HOM - DiameterCorrectionMeth = "taper" - HOM_TreeDataCor (numeric): HOM corresponding TaperDBH_TreeDataCor (= DefaultHOM)

title: TaperCorrection — TaperCorrection
code: library(data.table)  Data <- data.table(IdStem = "A",       ScientificName = "Tree",       Year = c(1998, 2008, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2021),       Diameter = c(19, 19, 21.4, 22.6, 23.1, 23.1, 23.6),       HOM = c(1.30, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25, 3.25))  Rslt <- TaperCorrection(Data) DiameterCorrectionPlot(Rslt, CorCol = "TaperDBH_TreeDataCor")

title: Correction of 2 diameter values — TwoValDiameterCor
text: DataTree dataset corresponding single tree/stem's (1 IdTree/IdStem) measurements (data.table) 'phylogenetic hierarchical' correction asked, dataset must contain columns: IdStem IdTree(character) ScientificNameCor (character) GenusCor (character) FamilyCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) Data Complete dataset (data.table) dataset must contain columns: IdStem IdTree (character) ScientificNameCor (character) GenusCor (character) FamilyCor (character) Diameter (numeric) Year (numeric) DBHCor Diameter vector cm (numeric) Time Time vector years (numeric) CorrectionType Possible values: NULL: 1st non-NA diameter value assigned 2nd non-NA diameter value "phylogenetic hierarchical": replace abnormal growth average growth trees dataset, specific, genus, family stand level, within DBH range x cm (DBHRange argument). number trees < n (MinIndividualNbr argument) specific level, switch genus level etc. PositiveGrowthThreshold cm/year : tree widening x cm/year considered abnormal (numeric, 1 value) NegativeGrowthThreshold cm/census : possible positive measurement error (+n) corrected growth appears abnormal, negative measurement error can allowed -n (tree decrease). Thus positive measurement error (+n) "compensated". (numeric, 1 value) DBHRange DBH range cm take account select trees dataset apply "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 10 cm) (numeric, 1 value) MinIndividualNbr Minimum number individuals take account "phylogenetic hierarchical" correction (Default: 5) (numeric, 1 value) OtherCrit criteria select individuals used calculation mean growth. Give name column(s) individuals must value tree correct (e.g. c("Plot", "Subplot")) (character) DetectOnly TRUE: detect errors, FALSE: detect correct errors (Default: FALSE) (logical)
